dismissalText.commentary: Quinton de Kock c Adair b Simi Singh 120 (91b 11x4 5x6 150m) SR: 131.86

dismissalComment.html: and there's the breakthrough. Shortish, but the ball skids on towards off stump and cramps de Kock for room on the pull. Hits it fairly well, but can't quite clear Adair, who takes it over his head right on the edge of the square leg boundary. He almost presses his heel down on the boundary cushions while taking the catch, but it looks like he's just about brought it under control while basically standing on tiptoe

dismissalText.commentary: Curtis Campher c Malan b Phehlukwayo 54 (54b 5x4 1x6 89m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: taken at midwicket. Looks like it's Malan again. Campher's exciting knock ends. It's a short ball rising at a middle stump line, he backs into the leg side and has a slog at that. Gets a top edge and Malan pedals backwards to settle under that and complete his third catch of the day

headshotImage.caption: Tabraiz Shamsi player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tabraiz Shamsi player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Harry Tector player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Harry Tector player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: caught right in front of off stump and lbw is given! Tector has a chat and reviews....but it seems like there's a confusion on whether he's reviewed in time. The umpire's ruled that he has reviewed late and Tector walks off, shaking his head. He held his arms aloft in protest, but the umpire's not having it. In all likelihood, it is a saved review for Ireland because this looked very out - full and turning in from off stump. He got his front leg across off stump and looked to flick and missed. It didn't turn a great deal and was full enough for height not to be an issue

headshotImage.caption: Mark Adair player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mark Adair player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: taken at deep midwicket. Short ball at middle stump, sits up nicely but the marginal turn has cramped him on his swing into the leg side. Carries nicely and taken without a fuss

headshotImage.caption: Josh Little player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Josh Little player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Klaasen gets a second chance and holds on. Another wrong'un, tossed up at a middle stump line. Steps out to try and slog another one. It comes off the toe-end and is to the fielder's left at long-on this time. Tracks it nicely and goes low to get his hands around this

headshotImage.caption: Andile Phelukwayo player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Andile Phelukwayo player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: GH Dockrell headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: GH Dockrell headshot

dismissalComment.html: gone! Just a bit of extra bounce from Phehlukwayo in the corridor. Back of a length, looking to guide it down to third man, probably, but it straightens and kicks up a little to find the edge through to de Kock. Terrific delivery to follow up all those wides

headshotImage.caption: Lorcan Tucker, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Lorcan Tucker, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalComment.html: got him, has he? It looked very out, and it's given out, but Tucker has reviewed. Good length ball angling into the stumps, and he walks across and misses a flick. It looked plumb at first glance... Past the inside edge, and it's hitting him in front of middle and off... Just clipping leg stump according to Hawkeye, and it will stay with the umpire's call. Tucker actually stepped out of his crease and stepped across his stumps, so that was probably the only thing that could have put any doubt in the umpire's mind. Play across the line like that, though, and you're much likelier to be given out

dismissalText.commentary: Paul Stirling c Malan b Maharaj 11 (13b 2x4 0x6 8m) SR: 84.61

dismissalComment.html: taken at slip! Maharaj has Stirling again! Slows that right down and draws him forward at an off stump line. Stirling is hesitant, initially shaping to push that into the leg side as it drifts. But that dips and holds its line as he tries to adjust and get the bottom hand off. Too late. Thick edge, and a smart grab low to the right. Just the man you want to get early when defending a big total

commentPreTextItems.html: Manvendra Singh: "Congrats Simi .... From one Singh to another .... The stuff dreams are made up of. No one can take this away. A one day centurion for all eternity"

commentTextItems.html: taken at mid-off. Young did his job, and now he has a hack at the fastest bowler in this game. Can't fault him. It's short and rising up at him, he can only slice it up for Bavuma who holds on and gestures in frustration

commentPostTextItems.html: 6.38pm And that is all we have for you today. We'll see you on the 19th for the T20I series. Have a good evening!

Temba Bavuma: We were good for a majority of the game. In the last 10-15 overs I did show a bit of frustration. The batting was awesome, Quinny and Janneman leading the way. Those are the type of performances we're looking for from the batting unit. So it was nice today. We hope it's the start of good things on this tour. Good confidence for the spinners. Keshav showed why he was a world class bowler. This augurs well. All in all from a bowling effort, it was a good showing.

J Malan: It's all about opportunities and it feels better to get runs in a winning cause. We just had some plans, luckily got some good net sessions, and it was great. IT was a privilege to bat with QDK.
Janneman Malan is the Player of the Series.

Andy Balbirnie: If we'd been asked, we'd have probably taken 1-1. But having won the second game we were really excited at the potential to win a series. They brought their big guns back in Quinny. We lost early wickets and that was a setback. But a lot to be positive about coming out of this. Some of our Young lads have really stood up. Been a really great week for Harry Tector, to name one. Curtis coming back after injury, and Josh bowled really well. Certainly 1-1 against a side like South Africa is a just reward. The atmosphere here is really brilliant, we didn't get to play at home last year so it was new to a lot of our guys. Been a lovely experience to play in front of such a crowd.

6.26pm It's hard to tell at the ground that Ireland have lost this game. Absolute warmth all around as Simi Singh walks off to applause. The series is tied 1-1. Ireland had their chance to get a series win against a team ranked in the top eight for the first time in history, but fell short today to Malan and De Kock. Still, they have been very, very good this series. South Africa knew they had to bring their best today, and a 225-run opening stand was quite a step in that direction. But you look at the final score, and how easy run-scoring got, and you can safely say that this match was buried when they decided to toss the new ball to Keshav Maharaj. He took out Stirling and Balbirnie early on, and it is not generally easy going for Ireland when one of those two don't get deep into the innings. Having said that, they will be very pleased with how Tector, Campher and Simi went today. 276 in a chase of 347 after being 92 for 6 is nothing to chuckle at. Lovely end to an evenly fought series. Ireland stay in fifth place on the Super League table. South Africa jump one place to 10th.

commentTextItems.html: there it is! Standing ovations all around for Simi Singh. What a lovely moment for him .THis is full outside off, he walks across to get in line and brings out a crisp drive to long-off's left. Young sprints for his life to make sure he can make the ground, and he makes it comfortably in the end. Lovely, confident knock after coming in at 92 for 6

dismissalComment.html: taken at slip! Maharaj has Stirling again! Slows that right down and draws him forward at an off stump line. Stirling is hesitant, initially shaping to push that into the leg side as it drifts. But that dips and holds its line as he tries to adjust and get the bottom hand off. Too late. Thick edge, and a smart grab low to the right. Just the man you want to get early when defending a big total

dismissalText.commentary: Harry Tector lbw b Shamsi 29 (34b 4x4 0x6 51m) SR: 85.29

dismissalComment.html: caught right in front of off stump and lbw is given! Tector has a chat and reviews....but it seems like there's a confusion on whether he's reviewed in time. The umpire's ruled that he has reviewed late and Tector walks off, shaking his head. He held his arms aloft in protest, but the umpire's not having it. In all likelihood, it is a saved review for Ireland because this looked very out - full and turning in from off stump. He got his front leg across off stump and looked to flick and missed. It didn't turn a great deal and was full enough for height not to be an issue

dismissalText.commentary: Lorcan Tucker lbw b Phehlukwayo 1 (8b 0x4 0x6 12m) SR: 12.5

dismissalComment.html: got him, has he? It looked very out, and it's given out, but Tucker has reviewed. Good length ball angling into the stumps, and he walks across and misses a flick. It looked plumb at first glance... Past the inside edge, and it's hitting him in front of middle and off... Just clipping leg stump according to Hawkeye, and it will stay with the umpire's call. Tucker actually stepped out of his crease and stepped across his stumps, so that was probably the only thing that could have put any doubt in the umpire's mind. Play across the line like that, though, and you're much likelier to be given out

dismissalComment.html: caught right in front of off stump and lbw is given! Tector has a chat and reviews....but it seems like there's a confusion on whether he's reviewed in time. The umpire's ruled that he has reviewed late and Tector walks off, shaking his head. He held his arms aloft in protest, but the umpire's not having it. In all likelihood, it is a saved review for Ireland because this looked very out - full and turning in from off stump. He got his front leg across off stump and looked to flick and missed. milestones.description: Campher and Simi Singh's 104-run partnership is IRE's highest for the 7th wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 76 between Paul Stirling and Dockrell
This is the highest match aggregate (622) involving teams South Africa & Ireland in ODIs
